page.title: 16GOSFORTH A CUMBRIAN VILLAGE
page.content: The village of Gosforth lies in two main parts; one clustered around the shops in the centre of the village, the other around the former Inn at Wellington. Between these lie the Church and the School. Before the coming of the Nuclear Power Station in the late '40's Gosforth was dependent on Agriculture.It had to be self-sufficient because busses ran on Thursdays and Saturdays only,as these were Whitehaven Market days,and cars were luxuries. The new industry employed many scientists,so Gosforth was developed by private builders in small estates.The first at the end of the village is called Maedowfield. It was begun in 1960 and has just had its third phase of development.There are now 3 estates and other houses at
